title: Fix Ctrl+C signal handling in interactive mode
description: When pressing Ctrl+C (^C) during an interactive session, the program prints 'Received interrupt signal. Saving session...' but doesn't actually exit. The process hangs because the main loop is blocked on bufio.Reader.ReadString() waiting for input, and this blocking call doesn't respond to the quit signal sent by the signal handler.

title: Fix signal handler to call os.Exit(0) after saving session
description:
Modify the signal handler goroutine in the Run() method (cmd/interactive.go lines 60-65) to call os.Exit(0) after saving the session instead of relying on the quit channel. The handler should:
1. Print 'Received interrupt signal. Saving session...'
2. Call is.saveSession()
3. Print 'Goodbye!'
4. Call os.Exit(0) to immediately terminate the process

This fixes the hanging issue where Ctrl+C doesn't actually exit because the main loop is blocked on ReadString().

title: Remove quit channel and simplify main loop
description:
Remove the unnecessary quit channel and simplify the main loop in cmd/interactive.go:
1. Remove 'quit chan bool' field from InteractiveSession struct (line 30)
2. Remove 'quit: make(chan bool)' from NewInteractiveSession (line 49)
3. Simplify the Run() method to remove the select statement and <-is.quit case
4. Convert the main loop from a select statement to a simple for { ... } with processInput() calls

Since we're exiting directly from the signal handler with os.Exit(0), the quit channel mechanism is no longer needed and can be safely removed to simplify the code.

title: Fix Error Handling in config.Load()
description:
